professional_direct.name: Professional & Direct
professional_direct.description: Straightforward, business-focused approach with clear value proposition
professional_direct.style_instructions:
- Be professional and direct
- Lead with value proposition
- Keep tone business-focused
- Use concrete data and metrics when possible
- Clear, specific call-to-action
professional_direct.message_length: 4-6 lines for short channels, 8-10 lines for email
professional_direct.personalization_level: Moderate - mention key achievements and pain points

warm_conversational.name: Warm & Conversational
warm_conversational.description: Friendly, relationship-focused approach that builds rapport
warm_conversational.style_instructions:
- Start with genuine compliment or shared interest
- Use conversational language (contractions, friendly tone)
- Build rapport before pitching
- Show authentic interest in their work
- Soft, low-pressure call-to-action
warm_conversational.message_length: 5-7 lines for short channels, 10-12 lines for email
warm_conversational.personalization_level: High - weave in personal details, interests, and recent activity

problem_agitation.name: Problem-Agitation-Solution
problem_agitation.description: Highlight pain points, amplify urgency, then present solution
problem_agitation.style_instructions:
- Open with a pain point they're likely facing
- Agitate by showing consequences or missed opportunities
- Present your solution as the answer
- Use emotional language that resonates with frustration
- Strong, urgent call-to-action
problem_agitation.message_length: 5-7 lines for short channels, 9-11 lines for email
problem_agitation.personalization_level: High - identify specific pain points from their profile
problem_agitation.cta_style: Urgent invitation to solve the problem

question_based.name: Question-Based Opener
question_based.description: Start with thought-provoking question to drive engagement
question_based.style_instructions:
- Open with a relevant, thought-provoking question
- Make them curious or self-reflective
- Follow up with context showing you understand their situation
- Present solution naturally as answer to the question
- CTA should be another question or invitation to discuss
question_based.message_length: 4-6 lines for short channels, 8-10 lines for email
question_based.personalization_level: High - question must be specific to their role/industry
question_based.cta_style: Question or invitation to explore further

value_first.name: Value-First (Give Before Ask)
value_first.description: Lead with free value, insight, or resource before any ask
value_first.style_instructions:
- Start by offering something valuable for free (insight, resource, tip)
- Show expertise through the value you provide
- Build credibility before pitching
- Make the ask secondary to the value provided
- Low-pressure CTA that continues value exchange
value_first.message_length: 5-7 lines for short channels, 10-12 lines for email
value_first.personalization_level: Moderate to High - value must be relevant to their needs
value_first.cta_style: Offer more value or continue conversation
